content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully created on the map. Although the agent repeatedly attempted to supply a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) by either placing or crafting one, all efforts failed because no Lab was available in the inventory and required sub-ingredients were missing. Pre‐existing smelting facilities (an iron furnace at Position(5.0, 5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(–27.0, –60.0)) were used to process ores but were not built by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
• API Invocation Issues:
  – When calling the get_entities function, avoid passing unexpected keyword arguments (such as “radius”) or positional arguments if the function accepts none. Verify the function signature before invocation.
  
• Lab Placement and Inventory Verification:
  – Before attempting to place a Lab (at Position(0.5, 2.5)), ensure that the Lab item is present in the inventory to prevent placement failures.
  
• Iterable Validation:
  – Check that any value returned from functions (e.g. when retrieving entities) is not None before iterating over it, to avoid errors like “‘NoneType’ object is not iterable.”
  
• Insufficient Resource and Sub-ingredient Provision:
  – Confirm that all required sub-ingredients (for example, iron-gear-wheels and electronic-circuits, with their dependent copper-cable and copper-plate needs) are sufficiently available before attempting to craft a Lab.
  – Maintain a robust resource production chain (including adequate smelting of iron and copper ores) to meet the recipe requirements for Lab crafting.
